Package org.opensextant.giscore.geometry

Class Point

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.geometry.Geometry
org.opensextant.giscore.geometry.GeometryBase
org.opensextant.giscore.geometry.Point
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IGISObject, VisitableGeometry, IDataSerializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Circle
public class Point extends GeometryBase
The Point class represents a single Geodetic point (Geodetic2DPoint or Geodetic3DPoint) for input and output in GIS formats such as ESRI Shapefiles or Google Earth KML files. In ESRI Shapefiles, this object corresponds to a ShapeType of Point or PointZ. In Google KML files, this object corresponds to a Geometry object of type Point.

Note Point extends GeometryBase including tessellate and drawOrder fields but those fields are not applicable to the Point geometry and ignored.

Author:
Paul Silvey
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Point

      public Point()
      Empty ctor only for object IO. Constructor must be followed by call to readData() to initialize the object instance otherwise object is invalid.
      See Also:
      • SimpleObjectInputStream
      • SimpleObjectOutputStream

    • Point

      public Point(double lat, double lon)
      Ctor, create a point given a lat and lon value in a WGS84 spatial reference system.
      Parameters:

      lon - the longitude in degrees

    • Point

      public Point(Latitude lat, Longitude lon)
      Create a point given a lat and lon value in a WGS84 spatial reference system.
      Parameters:
      lat - the latitude, never null
      lon - the longitude, never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if latitude or longitude are null

    • Point

      public Point(double lat, double lon, boolean is3d)
      Ctor, create a point given a lat and lon value in a WGS84 spatial reference system.
      Parameters:
      lat - the latitude in degrees
      lon - the longitude in degrees
      is3d - a three d point if true

    • Point

      public Point(double lat, double lon, double elevation)
      This constructor takes a Longitude, Latitude, and an elevation value in meters. The default elevation reference point (vertical datum) is the tangent surface plane touching the WGS84 Ellipsoid at the given longitude and latitude.
      Parameters:
      lat - the latitude in degrees
      lon - the longitude in degrees
      elevation - elevation in meters from the assumed reference point

    • Point

      public Point(Latitude lat, Longitude lon, Double elevation)
      This constructor takes a Longitude, Latitude, and an elevation value in meters.
      Parameters:
      lat - the latitude in degrees, never null
      lon - the longitude in degrees, never null
      elevation - elevation in meters from the assumed reference point if elevation is null then Geodetic2DPoint is created otherwise Geodetic3DPoint is created with the elvation.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if lat or lon are null

    • Point

      public Point(GeoPoint gp) throws IllegalArgumentException
      The Constructor takes a GeoPoint that is either a Geodetic2DPoint or a Geodetic3DPoint and initializes a Geometry object for it.

      Note GeoPoint object is copied by reference so caller must copy this point and/or construct a new GeoPoint object if need to modify its state after this constructor is invoked. Assumes GeoPoints are immutable if used in context of Point geometries.

      Parameters:
      gp - GeoPoint to initialize this Point with (must be Geodetic form)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if object is not valid.

    • computeBoundingBox

      protected void computeBoundingBox()
      Description copied from class: Geometry
      Compute a bounding box from the data for this geometry object. This is called if Geometry.getBoundingBox() is called and the bounding box is not set. This may be true if the object is initialized or if the object is copied over a network connection or has been otherwise serialized.
